flawed_nl_solution:
The flashlight was 1/5 of the price of the hoodie, so 80 * 1/5 = $<<80*1/5=16>>16.
The promotion for a pair of boots was 110 * 1/10 = $<<110*1/10=1100>>1100.
So the pair of boots cost 110 - 1100 = $<<110-1100=-990>>-990.
Celina therefore spent 80 + 16 + -990 = $<<80+16+-990=-894>>-894 on the equipment.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 11, not 1100. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
